conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a comedy of manners movie. Could you recommend a few?

Based on your preference for a comedy of manners, I'd recommend "Our Idiot Brother" (2011) starring Paul Rudd, Zooey Deschanel, and Emily Mortimer. This comedy centers around an idealistic brother who bungles into the lives of his three sisters, bringing laughter and heartwarming moments.

If you're in the mood for a classic comedy, you might also enjoy "Pocketful of Miracles" (1961) starring Ann-Margret and Glenn Ford. This film is about a group of individuals converging on a town with strange happenings and dark secrets, blending comedy with an intriguing plotline.

Enjoy your movie time!
